events.originalText: Amanda Berry escaped from the Cleveland, Ohio, home of her captor, Ariel Castro, having been held there with two other women for ten years.
events.subtitle: Cleveland
events.headline: Amanda Berry Escapes Captivity After 10 Years in Cleveland, Ohio

events.originalText: Exacerbated by high-frequency traders using strategies that have since been banned, major U.S. stock indices dropped nearly 9 percent and quickly rebounded.
events.subtitle: High-frequency trading
events.headline: U.S. Stock Indices Drop 9% Due to High-Frequency Traders

events.originalText: British barrister Mark Saunders was shot dead by police after a five-hour siege at his home in Chelsea, London.
events.subtitle: Barrister
events.headline: British Barrister Mark Saunders Shot Dead by Police in Chelsea, London

events.originalText: The final episode of the television sitcom Friends was aired.
events.subtitle: The Last One (Friends)
events.headline: Final Episode of Friends TV Sitcom Airs

events.originalText: Time magazine published the article "The Thriving Cult of Greed and Power" by Richard Behar criticizing the Church of Scientology, leading to years of legal conflict.
events.subtitle: Time (magazine)
events.headline: Time Magazine Publishes Article Criticizing Church of Scientology

events.originalText: Widerøe Flight 710 crashed into the fog-covered mountain of Torghatten in Brønnøy, Norway, killing all 36 people on board.
events.subtitle: Widerøe Flight 710
events.headline: Widerøe Flight 710 Crashes in Norway, Killing 36

events.originalText: At Oxford's Iffley Road Track, English runner Roger Bannister became the first person to run the mile in under four minutes.
events.subtitle: Oxford
events.headline: Roger Bannister Becomes First Person to Run Mile in Under 4 Minutes

events.originalText: American entertainer Bob Hope performed his first show with the United Service Organizations, beginning a 50-year involvement with them.
events.subtitle: Bob Hope
events.headline: Bob Hope Performs First Show with USO

events.originalText: The German airship Hindenburg caught fire and was destroyed during an attempt to dock at Lakehurst Naval Air Station in New Jersey, killing 36 people.
events.subtitle: LZ 129 Hindenburg
events.headline: German Airship Hindenburg Catches Fire, Killing 36

events.originalText: Imperial Trans-Antarctic Expedition: SY Aurora, anchored in McMurdo Sound, broke loose during a gale, beginning a 312-day ordeal  in the Ross Sea and Southern Ocean for her 18-man crew.
events.subtitle: Imperial Trans-Antarctic Expedition
events.headline: Imperial Trans-Antarctic Expedition Begins 312-Day Ordeal

events.originalText: Irish civil servants Thomas Henry Burke and Lord Frederick Cavendish were stabbed to death by members of the radical Irish National Invincibles in Phoenix Park, Dublin.
events.subtitle: Thomas Henry Burke (civil servant)
events.headline: Irish Civil Servants Stabbed to Death in Phoenix Park, Dublin

events.originalText: U.S. president Chester A. Arthur signed the Chinese Exclusion Act into law (cartoon pictured), implementing a ban on Chinese immigration to the United States that remained for 61 years.
events.subtitle: Chester A. Arthur
events.headline: Chinese Exclusion Act Signed into Law by U.S. President Chester A. Arthur

events.originalText: French Revolutionary Wars: The 32-gun Spanish frigate El Gamo was captured by the outmanned and outgunned HMS Speedy.
events.subtitle: French Revolutionary Wars
events.headline: Spanish Frigate El Gamo Captured by HMS Speedy

events.originalText: Construction began on the Grand Palace (pictured) in Bangkok, the official residence of the king of Thailand.
events.subtitle: Grand Palace
events.headline: Construction Begins on Grand Palace in Bangkok

events.originalText: English poet Christopher Smart was admitted to St Luke's Hospital for Lunatics in London, beginning his six-year confinement to mental asylums.
events.subtitle: Christopher Smart
events.headline: Poet Christopher Smart Admitted to St Luke's Hospital for Lunatics in London

events.originalText: Spanish conquest of the Inca Empire: Sapa Inca emperor Manco Inca Yupanqui's army began a ten-month siege of Cusco against a garrison of Spanish conquistadors and Indian auxiliaries led by Hernando Pizarro.
events.subtitle: Spanish conquest of the Inca Empire
events.headline: Inca Emperor Manco Inca Yupanqui's Army Begins Siege of Cusco Against Spanish Conquistadors
